result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Shannon C Steindorf was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant must attend and comply with the terms of alcohol court. Probation Review Hearing set 10/31/14 at 2:00 p.m. in Br. 1.

Defendant shall submit a DNA sample if not already recorded/submittedl Court does assess the DNA surcharge.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom. - to be done before first Alcohol Court appearance.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber, Transfer and Child Care privileges consecutive to sentence imposed in 14CT52.  Huber is for employment and treatment and Human Services.
Consecutive to: sentence imposed in 14CT52

(2:44) 14CF116, 14CM104 & 14CT52: Defendant Shannon C Steindorf in court with attorney William H. Gergen.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews recomm.; Def. to plead to OWI4th (14CF116) and OWI3rd (14CT52); discussion re: alcohol court; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to OWI4th in 14CF116 and OWI3rd in 14CT52 with BACs dismissed and all other counts to be D&RI; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; parties stip. to facts in each case; Court finds pleas made FV&K and finds Def. guilty of OWI3rd/Rep. w/BAC dismissed and all other counts D&RI, 14CM104 is D&RI, Court finds Def. guilty of OWI4th/Rep. w/BAC dismissed and OAR D&RI; State heard; Atty. Gergen heard (requests 60 days to report); Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. stated he cannot transfer title at this time until loan is paid off; report to P&P by 4:00pm on Friday; any bond money will be applied toward fines/costs

**W/H - 3 years PO concurrent on both - comm. immediately

Cases called 14CF116, 14cm104, 14ct52.  Defendant Shannon C Steindorf in court with attorney Stephanie R Strickland.  Gilbert G Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On 14cF116 - Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered.  Atty. Strickland is heard - requests that the cases stay together, she is leaving SPD and thinks it would be better to have same attorney on all cases.  Court questions Atty. Strickland about procedure to be removed from felony case.  Atty. Strickland moves to withdraw from all cases, Mr. Steindorf does not oppose.  Atty. Thompson is heard, takes no issue of withdrawal on felony, misdemeanors were already set for JT on 5/21/14.  Court grants request for withdrawal, Court will set for TSC on all cases.  Atty. Strickland requests JT be removed.  Discussion - Atty. Strickland agrees to the setting of TSC for next week.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
State's
Arraignment on May 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.
defendant's
not rec'd in the e-filing cue until 4/23/14, file stamp shows 4/14/14
OAR Citation
Acknowledgement by Person Posting Bail/Deposit

11:05 - Defendant Shannon C Steindorf in court with attorney Stephanie R Strickland.  Yolanda J Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Use PO Box 82 Horicon WI as mailing address. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1,000 Cash bond  with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
